results.definition: (Christianity) the abode of Satan and the forces of evil; where sinners suffer eternal punishment
examples: a demon from the depths of the pit
pit a chess player against the Russian champion

results.definition: lowered area in front of a stage where an orchestra accompanies the performers
a sizeable hole (usually in the ground)
examples: they dug a pit to bury the body

results.definition: a trap in the form of a concealed hole
a concavity in a surface (especially an anatomical depression)
the hard inner (usually woody) layer of the pericarp of some fruits (as peaches or plums or cherries or olives) that contains the seed
a surface excavation for extracting stone or slate
examples: a British term for `quarry' is `stone pit'

results.definition: a workplace consisting of a coal mine plus all the buildings and equipment connected with it
an enclosure in which animals are made to fight
(auto racing) an area at the side of a racetrack where the race cars are serviced and refueled
(commodity exchange) the part of the floor of a commodity exchange where trading in a particular commodity is carried on
